ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version

about.summary: Fits nonparametric item and option characteristic curves using kernel smoothing. It allows for optimal selection of the smoothing bandwidth using cross-validation and a variety of exploratory plotting tools. The kernel smoothing is based on methods described in Silverman, B.W. (1986). Density Estimation for Statistics and Data Analysis. Chapman & Hall, London.

Fits nonparametric item and option characteristic curves using kernel smoothing. It allows for optimal selection of the smoothing bandwidth using cross-validation and a variety of exploratory plotting tools. The kernel smoothing is based on methods described in Silverman, B.W. (1986). Density Estimation for Statistics and Data Analysis. Chapman & Hall, London.

name: r-kernsmoothirt

about.summary: Fits nonparametric item and option characteristic curves using kernel smoothing. It allows for optimal selection of the smoothing bandwidth using cross-validation and a variety of exploratory plotting tools. The kernel smoothing is based on methods described in Silverman, B.W. (1986). Density Estimation for Statistics and Data Analysis. Chapman & Hall, London.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '6.4' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-kernsmoothirt
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/KernSmoothIRT_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/KernSmoothIRT/KernSmoothIRT_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 9765e371eb1ae4a2dde948829a9f9edaacff29e9bdd79561bd0955021aab1463

build:
  number: 4
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}              # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}                # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}          # [win]
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}            # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_cxx') }}      # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - {{ cdt('mesa-libgl-devel') }}  # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('mesa-dri-drivers') }}  # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libselinux') }}  # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libxdamage') }}  # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libxxf86vm') }}  # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libxext') }}     # [linux]
  host:
    - xorg-libxfixes  # [linux]
    - r-base
    - r-rcpp
    - r-plotrix
    - r-rgl
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-rcpp
    - r-plotrix
    - r-rgl

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('KernSmoothIRT')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('KernSmoothIRT')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=KernSmoothIRT
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: Fits nonparametric item and option characteristic curves using kernel smoothing. It
    allows for optimal selection of the smoothing bandwidth using cross-validation and
    a variety of exploratory plotting tools. The kernel smoothing is based on methods
    described in Silverman, B.W. (1986). Density Estimation for Statistics and Data
    Analysis. Chapman & Hall, London.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - frankier

# Package: KernSmoothIRT
# Type: Package
# Title: Nonparametric Item Response Theory
# Version: 6.4
# Date: 2020-02-11
# Author: Angelo Mazza, Antonio Punzo, Brian McGuire
# Maintainer: Brian McGuire <mcguirebc@gmail.com>
# Description: Fits nonparametric item and option characteristic curves using kernel smoothing. It allows for optimal selection of the smoothing bandwidth using cross-validation and a variety of exploratory plotting tools. The kernel smoothing is based on methods described in Silverman, B.W. (1986). Density Estimation for Statistics and Data Analysis. Chapman & Hall, London.
# License: GPL-2
# LazyLoad: yes
# Imports: Rcpp, plotrix, rgl, methods
# LinkingTo: Rcpp
# Packaged: 2020-02-17 03:13:28 UTC; BrianMcGuire
# NeedsCompilation: yes
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2020-02-17 09:20:05 UTC

about.summary: Fits nonparametric item and option characteristic curves using kernel smoothing. It allows for optimal selection of the smoothing bandwidth using cross-validation and a variety of exploratory plotting tools. The kernel smoothing is based on methods described in Silverman, B.W. (1986). Density Estimation for Statistics and Data Analysis. Chapman & Hall, London.
